column4: Alright, so my problem is that I can't access the internet even though NDISwrapper recognizes my wireless card and wireless netowkrs.  I can connect to my network, but not the internet.  Currently, I am on my WIndows partition and I can access the internet just fine here (same network).  Here's the pastebin of a lot of commands I ran (I'm not sure which oens are relevant, I just ran everyone in the thread I found) http://pastebin.co
your pastbin link was cut short
it looks like wlan0 does not have an ipv4 address
your ISP gives you a static IP for your wireless network?
from your pastbin post when you ran dhclient wlan0, it did not recive any dhcpoffers. that means it can not contact a dhcp server. do you know what private range your wifi network is using?
can you find the ip address of that windows computer? you will also need dns and gateway settings
will ipconfig in cmd get the needed info?
now take those ip settings and put them into your ubuntu install. Right click on the network manager icon and choose edit connections.
i don't think so. make sure you put those setting in exactly like your windows pc
i'm beginning to suspect you may not be connected to the access point.
by using a static ip you have eliminated dhcp as the problem. there must be an issue joining the access point
do you have a way to view some kind of status page on your wifi router? maybe a log?
also on ubuntu you can run dmesg | grep wlan0. this could help locate the problem too
i hate to leave you hanging but i have to go. i hope you get your problem solved
it looks like it's making a connection but those may be from windows? really i need to go, i have 3 little ones to put to bed. :)
